title: Position Paper: Towards Open Complex Human-AI Agents Collaboration System for Problem-Solving and Knowledge Management
abstract: This position paper critically surveys a broad spectrum of recent empirical developments on human-AI agents collaboration, highlighting both their technical achievements and persistent gaps. We observe a lack of a unifying theoretical framework that can coherently integrate these varied studies, especially when tackling open-ended, complex tasks. To address this, we propose a novel conceptual architecture: one that systematically interlinks the technical details of multi-agent coordination, knowledge management, cybernetic feedback loops, and higher-level control mechanisms. By mapping existing contributions, from symbolic AI techniques and connectionist LLM-based agents to hybrid organizational practices, onto this proposed framework (Hierarchical Exploration-Exploitation Net), our approach facilitates revision of legacy methods and inspires new work that fuses qualitative and quantitative paradigms. The paper's structure allows it to be read from any section, serving equally as a critical review of technical implementations and as a forward-looking reference for designing or extending human-AI symbioses. Together, these insights offer a stepping stone toward deeper co-evolution of human cognition and AI capability.
subjects: Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI); Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC); Multiagent Systems (cs.MA)

AI.tldr: 本文批判性地调查了人类-AI代理协作的广泛实证发展，提出了一个新颖的概念架构，旨在整合多代理协调、知识管理、控制论反馈循环和高级控制机制的技术细节，以解决开放复杂任务中的理论框架缺乏问题。
AI.motivation: 解决在开放复杂任务中缺乏统一理论框架的问题，以促进人类认知与AI能力的更深层次共同进化。
AI.method: 提出了一种新颖的概念架构——层次探索-开发网络（Hierarchical Exploration-Exploitation Net），系统地连接了多代理协调、知识管理、控制论反馈循环和高级控制机制的技术细节。
AI.result: 通过将现有贡献映射到提出的框架上，该方法促进了传统方法的修订，并激发了融合定性和定量范式的新工作。
AI.conclusion: 本文不仅是对技术实现的关键回顾，也是设计或扩展人类-AI共生的前瞻性参考，为人类认知与AI能力的更深层次共同进化提供了垫脚石。

title: Visual Test-time Scaling for GUI Agent Grounding
abstract: We introduce RegionFocus, a visual test-time scaling approach for Vision Language Model Agents. Understanding webpages is challenging due to the visual complexity of GUI images and the large number of interface elements, making accurate action selection difficult. Our approach dynamically zooms in on relevant regions, reducing background clutter and improving grounding accuracy. To support this process, we propose an image-as-map mechanism that visualizes key landmarks at each step, providing a transparent action record and enables the agent to effectively choose among action candidates. Even with a simple region selection strategy, we observe significant performance gains of 28+\% on Screenspot-pro and 24+\% on WebVoyager benchmarks on top of two state-of-the-art open vision language model agents, UI-TARS and Qwen2.5-VL, highlighting the effectiveness of visual test-time scaling in interactive settings. We achieve a new state-of-the-art grounding performance of 61.6\% on the ScreenSpot-Pro benchmark by applying RegionFocus to a Qwen2.5-VL-72B model. Our code will be released publicly at
subjects: Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV); Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI); Machine Learning (cs.LG)

AI.tldr: RegionFocus是一种视觉测试时缩放方法，用于视觉语言模型代理，通过动态放大相关区域减少背景干扰，提高接地准确性，并在两个基准测试上实现了显著的性能提升。
AI.motivation: 理解网页由于GUI图像的视觉复杂性和大量界面元素而具有挑战性，导致准确选择动作困难。
AI.method: 提出了一种动态放大相关区域的视觉测试时缩放方法，并引入了图像作为地图的机制，以可视化每一步的关键地标。
AI.result: 在Screenspot-pro和WebVoyager基准测试上，性能分别提升了28%和24%，并在ScreenSpot-Pro基准测试上实现了61.6%的最新接地性能。
AI.conclusion: 视觉测试时缩放在交互式设置中有效，RegionFocus方法显著提高了视觉语言模型代理的性能。

title: Empowering Agentic Video Analytics Systems with Video Language Models
abstract: AI-driven video analytics has become increasingly pivotal across diverse domains. However, existing systems are often constrained to specific, predefined tasks, limiting their adaptability in open-ended analytical scenarios. The recent emergence of Video-Language Models (VLMs) as transformative technologies offers significant potential for enabling open-ended video understanding, reasoning, and analytics. Nevertheless, their limited context windows present challenges when processing ultra-long video content, which is prevalent in real-world applications. To address this, we introduce AVA, a VLM-powered system designed for open-ended, advanced video analytics. AVA incorporates two key innovations: (1) the near real-time construction of Event Knowledge Graphs (EKGs) for efficient indexing of long or continuous video streams, and (2) an agentic retrieval-generation mechanism that leverages EKGs to handle complex and diverse queries. Comprehensive evaluations on public benchmarks, LVBench and VideoMME-Long, demonstrate that AVA achieves state-of-the-art performance, attaining 62.3% and 64.1% accuracy, respectively, significantly surpassing existing VLM and video Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems. Furthermore, to evaluate video analytics in ultra-long and open-world video scenarios, we introduce a new benchmark, AVA-100. This benchmark comprises 8 videos, each exceeding 10 hours in duration, along with 120 manually annotated, diverse, and complex question-answer pairs. On AVA-100, AVA achieves top-tier performance with an accuracy of 75.8%.
subjects: Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV); Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI)

AI.tldr: AVA是一个基于视频语言模型(VLM)的系统，旨在解决开放视频分析的挑战，通过事件知识图(EKG)和代理检索生成机制，实现了在长视频和连续视频流中的高效分析和查询处理。
AI.motivation: 现有的视频分析系统通常局限于特定的预定义任务，难以适应开放式的分析场景，且视频语言模型(VLMs)在处理超长视频内容时存在上下文窗口有限的挑战。
AI.method: AVA系统引入了两个关键创新：近实时构建事件知识图(EKGs)以高效索引长或连续视频流，以及利用EKGs处理复杂多样查询的代理检索生成机制。
AI.result: 在公共基准测试LVBench和VideoMME-Long上，AVA分别达到了62.3%和64.1%的准确率，显著超过了现有的VLM和视频检索增强生成(RAG)系统。在新基准AVA-100上，AVA以75.8%的准确率取得了顶级性能。
AI.conclusion: AVA通过其创新方法在开放视频分析领域实现了最先进的性能，为处理超长和开放世界的视频场景提供了有效的解决方案。

title: Towards Autonomous Micromobility through Scalable Urban Simulation
abstract: Micromobility, which utilizes lightweight mobile machines moving in urban public spaces, such as delivery robots and mobility scooters, emerges as a promising alternative to vehicular mobility. Current micromobility depends mostly on human manual operation (in-person or remote control), which raises safety and efficiency concerns when navigating busy urban environments full of unpredictable obstacles and pedestrians. Assisting humans with AI agents in maneuvering micromobility devices presents a viable solution for enhancing safety and efficiency. In this work, we present a scalable urban simulation solution to advance autonomous micromobility. First, we build URBAN-SIM - a high-performance robot learning platform for large-scale training of embodied agents in interactive urban scenes. URBAN-SIM contains three critical modules: Hierarchical Urban Generation pipeline, Interactive Dynamics Generation strategy, and Asynchronous Scene Sampling scheme, to improve the diversity, realism, and efficiency of robot learning in simulation. Then, we propose URBAN-BENCH - a suite of essential tasks and benchmarks to gauge various capabilities of the AI agents in achieving autonomous micromobility. URBAN-BENCH includes eight tasks based on three core skills of the agents: Urban Locomotion, Urban Navigation, and Urban Traverse. We evaluate four robots with heterogeneous embodiments, such as the wheeled and legged robots, across these tasks. Experiments on diverse terrains and urban structures reveal each robot's strengths and limitations.
subjects: Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV); Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI); Robotics (cs.RO)

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种通过可扩展的城市模拟推进自主微移动性的解决方案，包括构建高性能机器人学习平台URBAN-SIM和提出评估AI代理能力的基准URBAN-BENCH。
AI.motivation: 解决当前微移动性依赖人工操作带来的安全和效率问题，通过AI代理辅助操作微移动设备。
AI.method: 构建URBAN-SIM平台，包含分层城市生成管道、交互动态生成策略和异步场景采样方案；提出URBAN-BENCH基准，评估AI代理在自主微移动性中的能力。
AI.result: 实验在不同地形和城市结构上进行，揭示了四种异构机器人（如轮式和腿式机器人）在各种任务中的优势和局限。
AI.conclusion: 通过URBAN-SIM和URBAN-BENCH，本研究为自主微移动性的发展提供了多样化和高效的训练与评估工具。

title: ScaleTrack: Scaling and back-tracking Automated GUI Agents
abstract: Automated GUI agents aims to facilitate user interaction by automatically performing complex tasks in digital environments, such as web, mobile, desktop devices. It receives textual task instruction and GUI description to generate executable actions (\emph{e.g.}, click) and operation boxes step by step. Training a GUI agent mainly involves grounding and planning stages, in which the GUI grounding focuses on finding the execution coordinates according to the task, while the planning stage aims to predict the next action based on historical actions. However, previous work suffers from the limitations of insufficient training data for GUI grounding, as well as the ignorance of backtracking historical behaviors for GUI planning. To handle the above challenges, we propose ScaleTrack, a training framework by scaling grounding and backtracking planning for automated GUI agents. We carefully collected GUI samples of different synthesis criterions from a wide range of sources, and unified them into the same template for training GUI grounding models. Moreover, we design a novel training strategy that predicts the next action from the current GUI image, while also backtracking the historical actions that led to the GUI image. In this way, ScaleTrack explains the correspondence between GUI images and actions, which effectively describes the evolution rules of the GUI environment. Extensive experimental results demonstrate the effectiveness of ScaleTrack. Data and code will be available at url.

AI.tldr: ScaleTrack是一个自动化GUI代理的训练框架，旨在通过扩展基础和回溯规划来解决GUI代理在训练中的数据不足和历史行为忽略问题。
AI.motivation: 自动化GUI代理在训练过程中面临基础数据不足和规划阶段忽视历史行为的限制，这影响了代理的性能和效率。
AI.method: ScaleTrack通过从广泛来源收集并统一不同合成标准的GUI样本，以及设计一种新颖的训练策略，即从当前GUI图像预测下一个动作同时回溯导致该图像的历史动作，来解决上述问题。
AI.result: 大量实验结果证明了ScaleTrack的有效性，它能够解释GUI图像与动作之间的对应关系，有效描述GUI环境的演变规则。
AI.conclusion: ScaleTrack通过其创新的训练框架和策略，显著提升了自动化GUI代理的性能，为未来的研究和应用提供了有价值的参考。数据和代码将在指定网址提供。

title: UserCentrix: An Agentic Memory-augmented AI Framework for Smart Spaces
abstract: Agentic AI, with its autonomous and proactive decision-making, has transformed smart environments. By integrating Generative AI (GenAI) and multi-agent systems, modern AI frameworks can dynamically adapt to user preferences, optimize data management, and improve resource allocation. This paper introduces UserCentrix, an agentic memory-augmented AI framework designed to enhance smart spaces through dynamic, context-aware decision-making. This framework integrates personalized Large Language Model (LLM) agents that leverage user preferences and LLM memory management to deliver proactive and adaptive assistance. Furthermore, it incorporates a hybrid hierarchical control system, balancing centralized and distributed processing to optimize real-time responsiveness while maintaining global situational awareness. UserCentrix achieves resource-efficient AI interactions by embedding memory-augmented reasoning, cooperative agent negotiation, and adaptive orchestration strategies. Our key contributions include (i) a self-organizing framework with proactive scaling based on task urgency, (ii) a Value of Information (VoI)-driven decision-making process, (iii) a meta-reasoning personal LLM agent, and (iv) an intelligent multi-agent coordination system for seamless environment adaptation. Experimental results across various models confirm the effectiveness of our approach in enhancing response accuracy, system efficiency, and computational resource management in real-world application.
subjects: Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI); Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC); Multiagent Systems (cs.MA); Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI)

AI.tldr: UserCentrix是一个代理性记忆增强AI框架，旨在通过动态、上下文感知的决策提升智能空间。它整合了个性化大型语言模型（LLM）代理，利用用户偏好和LLM记忆管理，提供主动和适应性强的辅助。
AI.motivation: 解决智能环境中如何更有效地适应用户偏好、优化数据管理和资源分配的问题。
AI.method: 采用混合分层控制系统，结合集中式和分布式处理，嵌入记忆增强推理、合作代理协商和自适应编排策略。
AI.result: 实验结果表明，该方法在提高响应准确性、系统效率和计算资源管理方面有效。
AI.conclusion: UserCentrix框架通过其创新的自我组织能力、信息价值驱动的决策过程和个人LLM代理，为智能空间提供了高效的解决方案。

title: Enhancing Speech-to-Speech Dialogue Modeling with End-to-End Retrieval-Augmented Generation
abstract: In recent years, end-to-end speech-to-speech (S2S) dialogue systems have garnered increasing research attention due to their advantages over traditional cascaded systems, including achieving lower latency and more natural integration of nonverbal cues such as emotion and speaker identity. However, these end-to-end systems face key challenges, particularly in incorporating external knowledge, a capability commonly addressed by Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) in text-based large language models (LLMs). The core difficulty lies in the modality gap between input speech and retrieved textual knowledge, which hinders effective integration. To address this issue, we propose a novel end-to-end RAG framework that directly retrieves relevant textual knowledge from speech queries, eliminating the need for intermediate speech-to-text conversion via techniques like ASR. Experimental results demonstrate that our method significantly improves the performance of end-to-end S2S dialogue systems while achieving higher retrieval efficiency. Although the overall performance still lags behind cascaded models, our framework offers a promising direction for enhancing knowledge integration in end-to-end S2S systems. We will release the code and dataset to support reproducibility and promote further research in this area.
subjects: Computation and Language (cs.CL); Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI); Information Retrieval (cs.IR)

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种新颖的端到端检索增强生成（RAG）框架，旨在解决语音到语音（S2S）对话系统中外部知识整合的挑战，通过直接从语音查询中检索相关文本知识，避免了中间语音到文本转换的需要。实验结果表明，该方法显著提高了端到端S2S对话系统的性能，并实现了更高的检索效率。
AI.motivation: 解决端到端语音到语音（S2S）对话系统在整合外部知识时面临的模态差距问题，特别是输入语音与检索到的文本知识之间的整合难题。
AI.method: 提出了一种端到端的检索增强生成（RAG）框架，直接从语音查询中检索相关文本知识，无需通过如ASR等技术进行中间语音到文本转换。
AI.result: 实验结果显示，该方法显著提升了端到端S2S对话系统的性能，同时实现了更高的检索效率，尽管整体性能仍落后于级联模型。
AI.conclusion: 该框架为增强端到端S2S系统中的知识整合提供了一个有前景的方向，作者将发布代码和数据集以支持可重复性并促进该领域的进一步研究。

title: Graph RAG for Legal Norms: A Hierarchical and Temporal Approach
abstract: This article proposes an adaptation of Graph Retrieval Augmented Generation (Graph RAG) specifically designed for the analysis and comprehension of legal norms, which are characterized by their predefined hierarchical structure, extensive network of internal and external references and multiple temporal versions. By combining structured knowledge graphs with contextually enriched text segments, Graph RAG offers a promising solution to address the inherent complexity and vast volume of legal data. The integration of hierarchical structure and temporal evolution into knowledge graphs - along with the concept of comprehensive Text Units - facilitates the construction of richer, interconnected representations of legal knowledge. Through a detailed analysis of Graph RAG and its application to legal norm datasets, this article aims to significantly advance the field of Artificial Intelligence applied to Law, creating opportunities for more effective systems in legal research, legislative analysis, and decision support.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种专为法律规范分析和理解设计的图检索增强生成（Graph RAG）方法，该方法结合了结构化知识图谱和上下文丰富的文本片段，以解决法律数据的复杂性和庞大性问题。
AI.motivation: 法律规范具有预定义的层次结构、广泛的内外部引用网络和多个时间版本，这使得其分析和理解变得复杂。本文旨在通过Graph RAG方法解决这些问题。
AI.method: 通过将层次结构和时间演变整合到知识图谱中，并结合全面的文本单元概念，构建更丰富、互联的法律知识表示。
AI.result: Graph RAG方法在法律规范数据集上的应用，为法律研究、立法分析和决策支持等领域提供了更有效的系统。
AI.conclusion: 本文提出的Graph RAG方法有望显著推动人工智能在法律领域的应用，为相关系统的发展创造更多机会。

title: CoordField: Coordination Field for Agentic UAV Task Allocation In Low-altitude Urban Scenarios
abstract: With the increasing demand for heterogeneous Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) swarms to perform complex tasks in urban environments, system design now faces major challenges, including efficient semantic understanding, flexible task planning, and the ability to dynamically adjust coordination strategies in response to evolving environmental conditions and continuously changing task requirements. To address the limitations of existing approaches, this paper proposes coordination field agentic system for coordinating heterogeneous UAV swarms in complex urban scenarios. In this system, large language models (LLMs) is responsible for interpreting high-level human instructions and converting them into executable commands for the UAV swarms, such as patrol and target tracking. Subsequently, a Coordination field mechanism is proposed to guide UAV motion and task selection, enabling decentralized and adaptive allocation of emergent tasks. A total of 50 rounds of comparative testing were conducted across different models in a 2D simulation space to evaluate their performance. Experimental results demonstrate that the proposed system achieves superior performance in terms of task coverage, response time, and adaptability to dynamic changes.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为CoordField的协调场代理系统，用于在复杂城市场景中协调异构无人机群。该系统利用大型语言模型（LLMs）解释高级人类指令并将其转换为无人机群可执行的命令，如巡逻和目标跟踪。通过协调场机制指导无人机运动和任务选择，实现了紧急任务的分散和自适应分配。在2D模拟空间中对不同模型进行了50轮比较测试，结果表明，该系统在任务覆盖范围、响应时间和动态变化适应性方面表现优异。
AI.motivation: 随着异构无人机群在城市环境中执行复杂任务的需求增加，系统设计面临高效语义理解、灵活任务规划以及动态调整协调策略以应对不断变化的环境条件和任务要求的重大挑战。
AI.method: 本文提出了一种协调场代理系统，结合大型语言模型（LLMs）解释指令和协调场机制指导无人机运动和任务选择，实现紧急任务的分散和自适应分配。
AI.result: 在2D模拟空间中对不同模型进行了50轮比较测试，实验结果表明，所提出的系统在任务覆盖范围、响应时间和动态变化适应性方面优于其他模型。
AI.conclusion: CoordField系统通过结合大型语言模型和协调场机制，有效地解决了异构无人机群在复杂城市场景中的任务分配和协调问题，展现出在任务覆盖、响应速度和适应性方面的优越性能。

title: HalluMix: A Task-Agnostic, Multi-Domain Benchmark for Real-World Hallucination Detection
abstract: As large language models (LLMs) are increasingly deployed in high-stakes domains, detecting hallucinated content$\unicode{x2013}$text that is not grounded in supporting evidence$\unicode{x2013}$has become a critical challenge. Existing benchmarks for hallucination detection are often synthetically generated, narrowly focused on extractive question answering, and fail to capture the complexity of real-world scenarios involving multi-document contexts and full-sentence outputs. We introduce the HalluMix Benchmark, a diverse, task-agnostic dataset that includes examples from a range of domains and formats. Using this benchmark, we evaluate seven hallucination detection systems$\unicode{x2013}$both open and closed source$\unicode{x2013}$highlighting differences in performance across tasks, document lengths, and input representations. Our analysis highlights substantial performance disparities between short and long contexts, with critical implications for real-world Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) implementations. Quotient Detections achieves the best overall performance, with an accuracy of 0.82 and an F1 score of 0.84.

AI.tldr: HalluMix基准是一个多样化的、任务无关的数据集，用于检测大型语言模型中的幻觉内容，覆盖多个领域和格式，评估了七种检测系统。
AI.motivation: 解决现有幻觉检测基准多为合成生成、局限于提取式问答，无法捕捉现实世界多文档上下文和完整句子输出复杂性的问题。
AI.method: 引入HalluMix Benchmark，一个包含多领域和格式示例的数据集，并评估了七种开放和封闭源的幻觉检测系统。
AI.result: 在长短上下文之间存在显著的性能差异，Quotient Detections以0.82的准确率和0.84的F1分数表现最佳。
AI.conclusion: HalluMix基准为现实世界中的检索增强生成（RAG）实现提供了重要启示，显示了在不同任务和上下文长度下检测系统的性能差异。

title: Rethinking Memory in AI: Taxonomy, Operations, Topics, and Future Directions
abstract: Memory is a fundamental component of AI systems, underpinning large language models (LLMs) based agents. While prior surveys have focused on memory applications with LLMs, they often overlook the atomic operations that underlie memory dynamics. In this survey, we first categorize memory representations into parametric, contextual structured, and contextual unstructured and then introduce six fundamental memory operations: Consolidation, Updating, Indexing, Forgetting, Retrieval, and Compression. We systematically map these operations to the most relevant research topics across long-term, long-context, parametric modification, and multi-source memory. By reframing memory systems through the lens of atomic operations and representation types, this survey provides a structured and dynamic perspective on research, benchmark datasets, and tools related to memory in AI, clarifying the functional interplay in LLMs based agents while outlining promising directions for future research\footnote{The paper list, datasets, methods and tools are available at \href{

AI.tldr: 本文重新思考了AI中的记忆系统，提出了记忆的分类、操作、研究主题及未来方向。通过将记忆表示分为参数化、上下文结构化和上下文非结构化，并引入六种基本记忆操作，为AI记忆研究提供了结构化视角。
AI.motivation: 解决现有研究中对记忆动态基础原子操作的忽视问题，为基于大型语言模型（LLMs）的代理提供更清晰的记忆功能交互视角。
AI.method: 首先对记忆表示进行分类，然后引入六种基本记忆操作，并系统地将这些操作映射到相关研究主题。
AI.result: 提出了一个结构化和动态的记忆研究视角，明确了LLMs代理中记忆功能的交互，并指出了未来研究的 promising 方向。
AI.conclusion: 通过原子操作和表示类型的视角重构记忆系统，为AI记忆研究提供了新的视角和工具，同时为未来研究指明了方向。

title: Online Federation For Mixtures of Proprietary Agents with Black-Box Encoders
abstract: Most industry-standard generative AIs and feature encoders are proprietary, offering only black-box access: their outputs are observable, but their internal parameters and architectures remain hidden from the end-user. This black-box access is especially limiting when constructing mixture-of-expert type ensemble models since the user cannot optimize each proprietary AI's internal parameters. Our problem naturally lends itself to a non-competitive game-theoretic lens where each proprietary AI (agent) is inherently competing against the other AI agents, with this competition arising naturally due to their obliviousness of the AI's to their internal structure. In contrast, the user acts as a central planner trying to synchronize the ensemble of competing AIs.
subjects: Machine Learning (cs.LG); Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI); Computer Science and Game Theory (cs.GT)

AI.tldr: 本文探讨了在专有生成AI和特征编码器仅提供黑盒访问的情况下，如何构建专家混合型集成模型的问题。通过非竞争性博弈论视角，分析了专有AI代理间的自然竞争，并提出了用户作为中央规划者协调这些竞争AI的方法。
AI.motivation: 解决在无法优化专有AI内部参数的情况下，构建高效的专家混合型集成模型的挑战。
AI.method: 采用非竞争性博弈论框架，将每个专有AI视为代理，用户作为中央规划者进行协调。
AI.result: 提出了一种在专有AI代理间自然竞争的环境中，通过中央规划者协调构建集成模型的方法。
AI.conclusion: 本研究为在专有AI黑盒访问限制下构建高效集成模型提供了新的视角和方法，具有重要的理论和实践意义。

title: LightEMMA: Lightweight End-to-End Multimodal Model for Autonomous Driving
abstract: Vision-Language Models (VLMs) have demonstrated significant potential for end-to-end autonomous driving. However, fully exploiting their capabilities for safe and reliable vehicle control remains an open research challenge. To systematically examine advances and limitations of VLMs in driving tasks, we introduce LightEMMA, a Lightweight End-to-End Multimodal Model for Autonomous driving. LightEMMA provides a unified, VLM-based autonomous driving framework without ad hoc customizations, enabling easy integration and evaluation of evolving state-of-the-art commercial and open-source models. We construct twelve autonomous driving agents using various VLMs and evaluate their performance on the nuScenes prediction task, comprehensively assessing metrics such as inference time, computational cost, and predictive accuracy. Illustrative examples highlight that, despite their strong scenario interpretation capabilities, VLMs' practical performance in autonomous driving tasks remains concerning, emphasizing the need for further improvements. The code is available at

AI.tldr: LightEMMA是一个轻量级的端到端多模态自动驾驶模型，旨在探索视觉语言模型（VLMs）在自动驾驶任务中的潜力和限制。
AI.motivation: 尽管视觉语言模型在端到端自动驾驶中显示出巨大潜力，但如何充分利用这些模型实现安全可靠的车辆控制仍是一个未解决的研究挑战。
AI.method: 引入LightEMMA，一个无需特别定制的统一VLM框架，便于集成和评估最新的商业和开源模型。通过构建十二个自动驾驶代理并在nuScenes预测任务上评估其性能。
AI.result: 评估了推理时间、计算成本和预测准确性等指标，发现尽管VLMs在场景解释能力上表现强劲，但在自动驾驶任务中的实际表现仍有待提高。
AI.conclusion: 强调了进一步改进的必要性，以提升VLMs在自动驾驶中的实用性能。

title: Surrogate modeling of Cellular-Potts Agent-Based Models as a segmentation task using the U-Net neural network architecture
abstract: The Cellular-Potts model is a powerful and ubiquitous framework for developing computational models for simulating complex multicellular biological systems. Cellular-Potts models (CPMs) are often computationally expensive due to the explicit modeling of interactions among large numbers of individual model agents and diffusive fields described by partial differential equations (PDEs). In this work, we develop a convolutional neural network (CNN) surrogate model using a U-Net architecture that accounts for periodic boundary conditions. We use this model to accelerate the evaluation of a mechanistic CPM previously used to investigate \textit{in vitro} vasculogenesis. The surrogate model was trained to predict 100 computational steps ahead (Monte-Carlo steps, MCS), accelerating simulation evaluations by a factor of 590 times compared to CPM code execution. Over multiple recursive evaluations, our model effectively captures the emergent behaviors demonstrated by the original Cellular-Potts model of such as vessel sprouting, extension and anastomosis, and contraction of vascular lacunae. This approach demonstrates the potential for deep learning to serve as efficient surrogate models for CPM simulations, enabling faster evaluation of computationally expensive CPM of biological processes at greater spatial and temporal scales.
subjects: Machine Learning (cs.LG); Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI); Quantitative Methods (q-bio.QM)

AI.tldr: 该论文开发了一种基于U-Net架构的卷积神经网络替代模型，用于加速细胞-波特模型的评估，显著提高了模拟效率。
AI.motivation: 细胞-波特模型（CPM）在模拟复杂多细胞生物系统时计算成本高昂，因为需要显式建模大量个体模型代理和偏微分方程描述的扩散场之间的相互作用。
AI.method: 使用考虑了周期性边界条件的U-Net架构的卷积神经网络（CNN）替代模型，训练该模型预测100个计算步骤（蒙特卡洛步骤，MCS）后的状态。
AI.result: 替代模型将模拟评估速度提高了590倍，有效捕捉了原始细胞-波特模型展示的涌现行为，如血管发芽、延伸和吻合，以及血管间隙的收缩。
AI.conclusion: 这种方法展示了深度学习作为CPM模拟高效替代模型的潜力，能够在更大的空间和时间尺度上更快地评估计算成本高昂的生物过程CPM。

title: AI2-Active Safety: AI-enabled Interaction-aware Active Safety Analysis with Vehicle Dynamics
abstract: This paper introduces an AI-enabled, interaction-aware active safety analysis framework that accounts for groupwise vehicle interactions. Specifically, the framework employs a bicycle model-augmented with road gradient considerations-to accurately capture vehicle dynamics. In parallel, a hypergraph-based AI model is developed to predict probabilistic trajectories of ambient traffic. By integrating these two components, the framework derives vehicle intra-spacing over a 3D road surface as the solution of a stochastic ordinary differential equation, yielding high-fidelity surrogate safety measures such as time-to-collision (TTC). To demonstrate its effectiveness, the framework is analyzed using stochastic numerical methods comprising 4th-order Runge-Kutta integration and AI inference, generating probability-weighted high-fidelity TTC (HF-TTC) distributions that reflect complex multi-agent maneuvers and behavioral uncertainties. Evaluated with HF-TTC against traditional constant-velocity TTC and non-interaction-aware approaches on highway datasets, the proposed framework offers a systematic methodology for active safety analysis with enhanced potential for improving safety perception in complex traffic environments.

AI.tldr: 本文介绍了一种AI驱动的、考虑群体车辆互动的主动安全分析框架，该框架结合了自行车模型和道路坡度考虑以准确捕捉车辆动态，并开发了基于超图的AI模型来预测周围交通的概率轨迹。通过整合这两个组件，框架在3D道路表面上推导车辆间距，作为随机常微分方程的解，产生高保真替代安全措施，如碰撞时间（TTC）。
AI.motivation: 解决复杂交通环境中，传统安全分析方法难以准确预测和评估多车辆互动下的安全风险的问题。
AI.method: 采用自行车模型增强道路坡度考虑，结合超图基础的AI模型预测交通轨迹，通过随机常微分方程求解车辆间距，使用4阶Runge-Kutta积分和AI推理生成概率加权的高保真TTC分布。
AI.result: 与传统恒定速度TTC和非互动感知方法相比，提出的框架在高速公路数据集上提供了更系统的主动安全分析方法，显著提高了复杂交通环境中的安全感知能力。
AI.conclusion: 该框架为复杂交通环境中的主动安全分析提供了一种系统的方法论，具有提高安全感知潜力的增强能力，为未来交通安全研究和技术开发提供了新的方向。

title: Humanizing LLMs: A Survey of Psychological Measurements with Tools, Datasets, and Human-Agent Applications
abstract: As large language models (LLMs) are increasingly used in human-centered tasks, assessing their psychological traits is crucial for understanding their social impact and ensuring trustworthy AI alignment. While existing reviews have covered some aspects of related research, several important areas have not been systematically discussed, including detailed discussions of diverse psychological tests, LLM-specific psychological datasets, and the applications of LLMs with psychological traits. To address this gap, we systematically review six key dimensions of applying psychological theories to LLMs: (1) assessment tools; (2) LLM-specific datasets; (3) evaluation metrics (consistency and stability); (4) empirical findings; (5) personality simulation methods; and (6) LLM-based behavior simulation. Our analysis highlights both the strengths and limitations of current methods. While some LLMs exhibit reproducible personality patterns under specific prompting schemes, significant variability remains across tasks and settings. Recognizing methodological challenges such as mismatches between psychological tools and LLMs' capabilities, as well as inconsistencies in evaluation practices, this study aims to propose future directions for developing more interpretable, robust, and generalizable psychological assessment frameworks for LLMs.
subjects: Computers and Society (cs.CY); Computation and Language (cs.CL); Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC); Machine Learning (cs.LG)

AI.tldr: 本文系统地回顾了将心理学理论应用于大型语言模型（LLMs）的六个关键维度，包括评估工具、LLM特定数据集、评估指标、实证发现、人格模拟方法和基于LLM的行为模拟，旨在提出未来发展方向，以开发更可解释、稳健和可推广的LLMs心理评估框架。
AI.motivation: 随着大型语言模型（LLMs）越来越多地用于以人为中心的任务，评估其心理特质对于理解其社会影响和确保可信赖的AI对齐至关重要。现有综述尚未系统讨论一些重要领域，如多样化的心理测试、LLM特定的心理数据集以及具有心理特质的LLMs应用。
AI.method: 本文系统地回顾了六个关键维度：评估工具、LLM特定数据集、评估指标（一致性和稳定性）、实证发现、人格模拟方法和基于LLM的行为模拟。
AI.result: 分析强调了当前方法的优势和局限性。虽然一些LLMs在特定提示方案下表现出可重复的人格模式，但在不同任务和设置中仍存在显著变异性。
AI.conclusion: 认识到心理学工具与LLMs能力之间的不匹配以及评估实践中的不一致性等方法论挑战，本研究旨在为开发更可解释、稳健和可推广的LLMs心理评估框架提出未来方向。

title: Optimization of embeddings storage for RAG systems using quantization and dimensionality reduction techniques
abstract: Retrieval-Augmented Generation enhances language models by retrieving relevant information from external knowledge bases, relying on high-dimensional vector embeddings typically stored in float32 precision. However, storing these embeddings at scale presents significant memory challenges. To address this issue, we systematically investigate on MTEB benchmark two complementary optimization strategies: quantization, evaluating standard formats (float16, int8, binary) and low-bit floating-point types (float8), and dimensionality reduction, assessing methods like PCA, Kernel PCA, UMAP, Random Projections and Autoencoders. Our results show that float8 quantization achieves a 4x storage reduction with minimal performance degradation (<0.3%), significantly outperforming int8 quantization at the same compression level, being simpler to implement. PCA emerges as the most effective dimensionality reduction technique. Crucially, combining moderate PCA (e.g., retaining 50% dimensions) with float8 quantization offers an excellent trade-off, achieving 8x total compression with less performance impact than using int8 alone (which provides only 4x compression). To facilitate practical application, we propose a methodology based on visualizing the performance-storage trade-off space to identify the optimal configuration that maximizes performance within their specific memory constraints.
subjects: Information Retrieval (cs.IR); Computation and Language (cs.CL); Databases (cs.DB)

AI.tldr: 本文探讨了通过量化和降维技术优化RAG系统中嵌入存储的方法，提出了float8量化和PCA降维的结合使用，实现了8倍的压缩比且性能影响最小。
AI.motivation: 解决RAG系统中高维向量嵌入存储带来的内存挑战。
AI.method: 系统地评估了量化（包括float16、int8、binary和float8）和降维（如PCA、Kernel PCA、UMAP、随机投影和自编码器）两种优化策略。
AI.result: float8量化实现了4倍的存储减少且性能下降小于0.3%，PCA是最有效的降维技术。结合50%维度的PCA和float8量化，实现了8倍的总压缩比，性能影响小于单独使用int8量化。
AI.conclusion: 提出了一种基于性能-存储权衡空间可视化的方法，帮助在特定内存约束下找到最优配置，为RAG系统的嵌入存储优化提供了实用方案。

title: Which Agent Causes Task Failures and When? On Automated Failure Attribution of LLM Multi-Agent Systems
abstract: Failure attribution in LLM multi-agent systems-identifying the agent and step responsible for task failures-provides crucial clues for systems debugging but remains underexplored and labor-intensive. In this paper, we propose and formulate a new research area: automated failure attribution for LLM multi-agent systems. To support this initiative, we introduce the Who&When dataset, comprising extensive failure logs from 127 LLM multi-agent systems with fine-grained annotations linking failures to specific agents and decisive error steps. Using the Who&When, we develop and evaluate three automated failure attribution methods, summarizing their corresponding pros and cons. The best method achieves 53.5% accuracy in identifying failure-responsible agents but only 14.2% in pinpointing failure steps, with some methods performing below random. Even SOTA reasoning models, such as OpenAI o1 and DeepSeek R1, fail to achieve practical usability. These results highlight the task's complexity and the need for further research in this area. Code and dataset are available at

AI.tldr: 本文提出了LLM多智能体系统中的自动故障归因新研究领域，并介绍了Who&When数据集，用于支持这一研究。通过评估三种自动故障归因方法，揭示了任务的复杂性和进一步研究的必要性。
AI.motivation: 解决LLM多智能体系统中识别导致任务失败的代理和步骤的问题，该系统调试提供了重要线索，但目前研究不足且劳动密集型。
AI.method: 引入Who&When数据集，包含127个LLM多智能体系统的失败日志，并开发评估了三种自动故障归因方法。
AI.result: 最佳方法在识别故障责任代理上达到53.5%的准确率，但在确定故障步骤上仅14.2%，部分方法表现低于随机。即使是SOTA推理模型也未能达到实际可用性。
AI.conclusion: 自动故障归因任务复杂，现有方法效果有限，凸显了进一步研究的必要性。

title: Self-Generated In-Context Examples Improve LLM Agents for Sequential Decision-Making Tasks
abstract: Many methods for improving Large Language Model (LLM) agents for sequential decision-making tasks depend on task-specific knowledge engineering--such as prompt tuning, curated in-context examples, or customized observation and action spaces. Using these approaches, agent performance improves with the quality or amount of knowledge engineering invested. Instead, we investigate how LLM agents can automatically improve their performance by learning in-context from their own successful experiences on similar tasks. Rather than relying on task-specific knowledge engineering, we focus on constructing and refining a database of self-generated examples. We demonstrate that even a naive accumulation of successful trajectories across training tasks boosts test performance on three benchmarks: ALFWorld (73% to 89%), Wordcraft (55% to 64%), and InterCode-SQL (75% to 79%)--matching the performance the initial agent achieves if allowed two to three attempts per task. We then introduce two extensions: (1) database-level selection through population-based training to identify high-performing example collections, and (2) exemplar-level selection that retains individual trajectories based on their empirical utility as in-context examples. These extensions further enhance performance, achieving 91% on ALFWorld--matching more complex approaches that employ task-specific components and prompts. Our results demonstrate that automatic trajectory database construction offers a compelling alternative to labor-intensive knowledge engineering.

AI.tldr: 本文研究了如何通过自我生成的情境示例来提升大型语言模型（LLM）代理在顺序决策任务中的表现，而不是依赖特定任务的知识工程。通过构建和优化自我生成的示例数据库，即使在简单的成功轨迹积累下，也能显著提高测试性能。进一步引入了数据库级别和示例级别的选择机制，进一步提升了性能，与使用特定任务组件和提示的更复杂方法相媲美。
AI.motivation: 解决依赖特定任务知识工程（如提示调整、精选情境示例或定制观察和动作空间）来提升LLM代理在顺序决策任务中表现的问题，探索如何通过自我学习来提升性能。
AI.method: 构建和优化自我生成的示例数据库，包括简单的成功轨迹积累、数据库级别的选择（通过基于群体的训练）和示例级别的选择（基于个体轨迹作为情境示例的经验效用）。
AI.result: 在ALFWorld（73%到89%）、Wordcraft（55%到64%）和InterCode-SQL（75%到79%）三个基准测试中，性能显著提升。进一步的扩展使ALFWorld的性能达到91%，与使用特定任务组件和提示的更复杂方法相媲美。
AI.conclusion: 自动轨迹数据库构建提供了一种有吸引力的替代方案，可以替代劳动密集型的知识工程，显著提升LLM代理在顺序决策任务中的表现。

title: EnronQA: Towards Personalized RAG over Private Documents
abstract: Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) has become one of the most popular methods for bringing knowledge-intensive context to large language models (LLM) because of its ability to bring local context at inference time without the cost or data leakage risks associated with fine-tuning. A clear separation of private information from the LLM training has made RAG the basis for many enterprise LLM workloads as it allows the company to augment LLM's understanding using customers' private documents. Despite its popularity for private documents in enterprise deployments, current RAG benchmarks for validating and optimizing RAG pipelines draw their corpora from public data such as Wikipedia or generic web pages and offer little to no personal context. Seeking to empower more personal and private RAG we release the EnronQA benchmark, a dataset of 103,638 emails with 528,304 question-answer pairs across 150 different user inboxes. EnronQA enables better benchmarking of RAG pipelines over private data and allows for experimentation on the introduction of personalized retrieval settings over realistic data. Finally, we use EnronQA to explore the tradeoff in memorization and retrieval when reasoning over private documents.

AI.tldr: 本文介绍了EnronQA基准测试，一个包含103,638封电子邮件和528,304个问答对的数据集，旨在促进对私有文档的个性化检索增强生成（RAG）研究。
AI.motivation: 当前RAG基准测试主要使用公开数据，缺乏对私有文档和个人化上下文的研究，这限制了RAG在私有数据上的应用和优化。
AI.method: 发布EnronQA数据集，包含来自150个不同用户收件箱的电子邮件和问答对，用于更好地评估和优化RAG管道在私有数据上的性能。
AI.result: EnronQA为私有文档上的RAG研究提供了丰富的实验数据，支持探索个性化检索设置和记忆与检索之间的权衡。
AI.conclusion: EnronQA基准测试的发布填补了私有文档RAG研究的空白，为未来的个性化RAG应用和优化提供了重要资源。

title: Variational OOD State Correction for Offline Reinforcement Learning
abstract: The performance of Offline reinforcement learning is significantly impacted by the issue of state distributional shift, and out-of-distribution (OOD) state correction is a popular approach to address this problem. In this paper, we propose a novel method named Density-Aware Safety Perception (DASP) for OOD state correction. Specifically, our method encourages the agent to prioritize actions that lead to outcomes with higher data density, thereby promoting its operation within or the return to in-distribution (safe) regions. To achieve this, we optimize the objective within a variational framework that concurrently considers both the potential outcomes of decision-making and their density, thus providing crucial contextual information for safe decision-making. Finally, we validate the effectiveness and feasibility of our proposed method through extensive experimental evaluations on the offline MuJoCo and AntMaze suites.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为Density-Aware Safety Perception (DASP)的新方法，用于解决离线强化学习中的状态分布偏移问题，通过鼓励智能体优先选择导致更高数据密度结果的动作，促进其在分布内（安全）区域的操作或返回。
AI.motivation: 离线强化学习的性能受到状态分布偏移问题的显著影响，本文旨在通过提出一种新的OOD状态校正方法来应对这一挑战。
AI.method: 本文提出的DASP方法在一个变分框架内优化目标，同时考虑决策的潜在结果及其密度，为安全决策提供关键的上下文信息。
AI.result: 通过在离线MuJoCo和AntMaze套件上的广泛实验评估，验证了所提方法的有效性和可行性。
AI.conclusion: DASP方法有效地解决了离线强化学习中的状态分布偏移问题，通过优先考虑高数据密度的动作，促进了智能体在安全区域内的操作，为离线强化学习的安全决策提供了新的视角。

title: Safety-Critical Traffic Simulation with Guided Latent Diffusion Model
abstract: Safety-critical traffic simulation plays a crucial role in evaluating autonomous driving systems under rare and challenging scenarios. However, existing approaches often generate unrealistic scenarios due to insufficient consideration of physical plausibility and suffer from low generation efficiency. To address these limitations, we propose a guided latent diffusion model (LDM) capable of generating physically realistic and adversarial safety-critical traffic scenarios. Specifically, our model employs a graph-based variational autoencoder (VAE) to learn a compact latent space that captures complex multi-agent interactions while improving computational efficiency. Within this latent space, the diffusion model performs the denoising process to produce realistic trajectories. To enable controllable and adversarial scenario generation, we introduce novel guidance objectives that drive the diffusion process toward producing adversarial and behaviorally realistic driving behaviors. Furthermore, we develop a sample selection module based on physical feasibility checks to further enhance the physical plausibility of the generated scenarios. Extensive experiments on the nuScenes dataset demonstrate that our method achieves superior adversarial effectiveness and generation efficiency compared to existing baselines while maintaining a high level of realism. Our work provides an effective tool for realistic safety-critical scenario simulation, paving the way for more robust evaluation of autonomous driving systems.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种引导潜在扩散模型（LDM），用于生成物理真实且对抗性的安全关键交通场景，以提高自动驾驶系统的评估效果。
AI.motivation: 现有的安全关键交通模拟方法由于对物理合理性的考虑不足，常生成不现实的场景，且生成效率低下。
AI.method: 采用基于图的变分自编码器（VAE）学习捕捉多智能体交互的紧凑潜在空间，并在该空间内通过扩散模型进行去噪过程生成真实轨迹。引入新的引导目标以实现可控和对抗性场景生成，并开发基于物理可行性检查的样本选择模块。
AI.result: 在nuScenes数据集上的大量实验表明，该方法在保持高真实性的同时，相比现有基线具有更优的对抗效果和生成效率。
AI.conclusion: 本研究为真实安全关键场景模拟提供了有效工具，为自动驾驶系统的更稳健评估铺平了道路。

title: A Finite-State Controller Based Offline Solver for Deterministic POMDPs
abstract: Deterministic partially observable Markov decision processes (DetPOMDPs) often arise in planning problems where the agent is uncertain about its environmental state but can act and observe deterministically. In this paper, we propose DetMCVI, an adaptation of the Monte Carlo Value Iteration (MCVI) algorithm for DetPOMDPs, which builds policies in the form of finite-state controllers (FSCs). DetMCVI solves large problems with a high success rate, outperforming existing baselines for DetPOMDPs. We also verify the performance of the algorithm in a real-world mobile robot forest mapping scenario.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了DetMCVI，一种针对确定性部分可观察马尔可夫决策过程（DetPOMDPs）的蒙特卡洛值迭代（MCVI）算法变体，通过构建有限状态控制器（FSCs）形式的策略来解决大规模问题，并在实际移动机器人森林地图绘制场景中验证了其性能。
AI.motivation: 解决在代理对环境状态不确定但可以确定性地行动和观察的规划问题中出现的DetPOMDPs。
AI.method: 提出了DetMCVI算法，这是MCVI算法的一个变体，专门为DetPOMDPs设计，通过构建有限状态控制器（FSCs）形式的策略来解决问题。
AI.result: DetMCVI能够以高成功率解决大规模问题，并且在DetPOMDPs上优于现有基线。
AI.conclusion: DetMCVI算法在理论和实际应用中均表现出色，特别是在移动机器人森林地图绘制等实际场景中验证了其有效性。
